intro: Salacia whytei var. vermoeseniana, commonly known as the Red-veined Caper, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, often followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
